question_text: Find the complete set of solutions to -8 < 6 - x/2
A nuclide 82/214 Pb changes by radioactive decay into the nuclide 82/210 Pb. Which combination of emissions produces this change?
Which one of the following is a simplification of (2^23)^(−1)?
The graph shown of quantity y against quantity x represents the motion of a body. Which two of the following could the graph represent?
The ratio of Q:R is 5:2 and the ratio of R:S is 3:10. Which one of the following gives the ratio Q:S in its simplest form?
A uranium-235 nucleus can undergo fission to produce two smaller nuclei. Which of the diagrams, if any, could represent this process?
The mean age of the twenty members of a running club is exactly 28. The mean age increases by exactly 2 years when two new members join. What is the mean age of the two new members?

A circuit consists of a 5.0 Ω resistor and a variable resistor connected in series with a 24 V battery. The variable resistor has a minimum resistance of 3.0 Ω and a maximum resistance of 15 Ω. The battery and the connecting wires have negligible resistance. What is the maximum power dissipated in the 5.0 Ω resistor?
A medical scanner is bought for £15 000. The value of the scanner depreciates by 20% every year. By how much has the scanner reduced in value after 2 years?

The total power P radiated by a star is given by P = kR^2T^4, where R is the radius of the star, T is its surface temperature and k is a constant. The power currently radiated by the Sun is 4.0 × 10^26 W. Towards the end of the Sun’s life its radius will increase by a factor of a hundred and its surface temperature will decrease by a factor of two. What will be the power radiated by the Sun when these changes have occurred?
The point A is 4 km due East of the point B. The bearing of the point C from A is 330° and the bearing of C from B is 60°. Find the distance BC.

A transverse wave travelling through a medium has a frequency of 5.0 Hz, a wavelength of 4.0 cm and an amplitude of 3.0 cm. What is the total distance travelled by a particle of the medium in one minute?
The quantities x and y are positive. x is inversely proportional to the square root of y. When x = 8, y = 9. What is the value of y when x = 6?

A motor is used to lift a mass of 5.0 kg using a pulley system. The motor needs to cause the mass to accelerate upwards at 0.80 m s–2. What is the minimum tension force that the coupling must be able to withstand without breaking?
In a trapezium PQRS, the parallel sides are PQ and RS. PQ = (x − 1) cm, RS = (x + 5) cm and the vertical height QR = x cm. The area of the trapezium is 120 cm². What is the length of RS?

A heater is connected in series with a resistor and a 6.0 V battery. The total resistance of the circuit is 15 Ω. In 3.0 minutes, 180 J of electrical energy is transferred into other forms in the heater. How much charge flows through the heater in the 3.0 minutes and what is the voltage across the heater?
Make b the subject of the formula: a = (b^2 + 2)/(2b − 13).
A cubic block has a hole through it with a square cross-section. The weight of the block is 30 N. What is the density of the material from which the block is made? (g = 10 N kg–1).
A thin rectangular sheet of metal 10 m by 5 m is made into an open ended cylinder by joining the edges PS and QR. The height of the cylinder is 10 m. What is the volume enclosed by this cylinder?

The diagram shows four solid steel balls P, Q, R and S. Balls P and R have shiny surfaces. Balls Q and S have dull surfaces. Balls P and Q are in a room at 20°C. Balls R and S are in a room at 40°C. Which two balls lose thermal energy by convection, and which ball emits thermal radiation at the greatest rate?
Which one of the following is a simplification of (x^4 − 2x^2 + 4)/(x^2 − 2)?

The diagram shows the velocity-time graph for an object travelling in a straight line over a period of 30 s. What total distance did the object travel, how far from its starting position was it, and what was its average speed over the 30 s?

During summer activities week 120 students each chose one activity from swimming, archery, and tennis. 46 of the students were girls. 36 chose tennis, two-thirds of these were boys; 25 girls chose swimming, and 27 students chose archery. A boy is picked at random. What is the probability that he chose swimming?
Bronze is a mixture of tin and copper. A particular sample of bronze contains 10% tin by volume. What percentage of the mass of the sample is tin? (Density of tin = Y, density of copper = X).
Which one of the following expressions is equivalent to (12n^3 − 34n + 43)/(n − 2)?

When a stationary uranium-238 nucleus decays by alpha emission it forms a nucleus of thorium-234. The total kinetic energy produced by the decay is E. What is the kinetic energy of the alpha particle?

In the diagram below, PQRS is part of a regular polygon. The side PQ is extended to T such that PQT is a straight line. The length of RQ is the same as the length of RT. Find an equation for n in terms of x, where x is the size of angle QRT in degrees.

A student carries out an experiment to measure the speed of sound. A loudspeaker that emits sound in all directions is placed between two buildings that are 128 m apart. The student and loudspeaker are 48 m from one of the buildings. The student notices that each click results in two echoes. The rate at which the clicks are produced is gradually increased until each echo coincides with a new click. What is the frequency of emission of clicks when this happens? (Speed of sound in air = 320 m/s).
When x=2 is substituted in the expression x^3 + p x^2 + qx + 2, the result is 0. When x=1 is substituted, the result is −53. Find all possible values of p.

A parachutist is falling at terminal speed with his parachute open. The diagrams show, separately, the vertical forces acting on the parachute and the vertical forces acting on the parachutist. Which of the given equations are direct results of Newton’s Third Law?

A square PQRS is drawn above the x-axis with the side PQ on the x-axis. P is the point (−5,0) and Q is (1,0). A circle is drawn inside the square with diameter equal to the side of the square. Which one of the following is an equation of the circle?

A crate has a total mass of 800 kg, including its contents. A helicopter of mass 4200 kg is carrying the crate using a light rope. The helicopter and crate are accelerating upwards at 2.0 m s–2. What is the tension in the rope? (g=10 N/kg).
The first term of a convergent geometric series is 8. The fifth term is 2. The sixth term is real and positive. What is the sum to infinity of this series?

A shopper pushes a supermarket trolley a distance of 15 m in a straight line across a horizontal surface. The shopper applies a constant force of 50 N at an angle of 37° below the horizontal. The trolley weight is 350 N. What is the vertical force from the surface and the work done?
Tangents are drawn from a point P to a circle of radius 10 cm. The centre of the circle is C and PC = 20 cm. Which one of the following is an expression for the shaded area in cm²?

A plank of non-uniform density (15 kg) is used to make a see-saw with pivot at the centre. A 35 kg boy sits 1.20 m from pivot. A 60 kg woman sits 0.80 m on the other side. Where is the centre of gravity of the plank and what is the reaction force from the pivot?
Given that cosθ tanθ − sinθ = 3/7, which one of the following is true?

A car of mass 200 kg on a fairground ride travels at 5.0 m/s at point X (height 8.0 m). When it reaches point Y (height 2.0 m), its speed is 9.0 m/s. How much energy is transferred in overcoming resistive forces as the car travels from X to Y? (g = 10 N/kg).
The complete set of values of a for which the equation x^2 + (a+3)x + (a−2) = 0 has two real distinct roots is:

A uniform solid cube rests with one edge in contact with a table. A horizontal force P acts on another edge of the cube, which is stationary. Which of the statements about forces on the cube are correct?
The line y = mx + 3, with m > 1, is perpendicular to the line y = px + 2. The lines cut the x-axis at points L and M. The length LM = 5. What is the value of m + p?
Two identical blocks of mass m are placed in two different arrangements. Which expression gives: (GPE of arrangement 2) − (GPE of arrangement 1)?
f(x) = ax^3 − x^2, where a is positive. Find the complete set of values of x for which f(x) is increasing.
An object is fired vertically upwards at 8.0 m/s. On the way up, what is the height when its speed is 2.0 m/s, and at what time does it reach this height on the way down? (g = 10 m/s²).
The curve y = x^2 is translated by (3,4) and then reflected in the line y = −1. Which is an equation of the resulting curve?
A 4.0 kg ball P moves at 10 m/s towards a stationary 2.0 kg ball Q. After collision, Q moves at 10 m/s to the right. What is the velocity of P after collision, and how much kinetic energy is lost?
The complete set of values of x for which 4x^2 − 9x + 2 > 0 is:

A point object of mass 2.0 kg is at rest on a level surface. Coefficient of friction = 0.25. Two horizontal forces at right angles of 9.0 N and 12.0 N act simultaneously. What is the magnitude of the acceleration as it begins to move? (g = 10 m/s²).
Solve the inequality x^2 − 5x − 24 < 0.
Two charges +Q and −Q are placed at equal distances on either side of the origin along the x-axis. Which graph best shows the variation of electric potential along the y-axis?
The function f is defined for all real values of x, except x = 2, by f(x) = (x^2 − 4)/(x − 2). What is the range of f?
A mass-spring system oscillates with amplitude A and frequency f. What is the maximum speed of the mass?
Solve the equation log_2(x − 1) + log_2(x + 3) = 3.
A block slides from rest down a frictionless incline of height h. At the bottom it collides elastically with a stationary block of equal mass. Which statement is correct?
options: The first block stops, the second moves with speed √(2gh).
The first block continues at √(2gh), the second stays at rest.
The first block and second block both move with √(gh).
The first block moves with √(gh), the second moves with √(gh).
